intro: Stenostephanus lobeliiformis var. subsessilis, commonly known as the slender stephanus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
